page.title: 17COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Situated on the main A97 road at the entry to the village is a telephone kiosk with an old coin-operated pay box with a ten-pence and five- pence slot,the latter one being sealed off. The Post Office is now part of a house and the post box is situated opposite, on a metal post outside the old shop. (When the shop until recently included the Post Office the post box was set into the wall and could be emptied from inside the building). On Corskie Hill (NJ547326,Lat 57 22'54"N Long 02 45'13"W) is a UHF Relay Station called "Gartly Moor" owned by the IBA but is used also by the BBC. The signal source is Durris and the receiving area extends in a rough triangular shape from Cairnie to Old Rayne,Insch,Clatt,Lumsden,Rhynie and omitting Gartly village itself as it is set at the foot of the hill.
